title.narrative: Improving Food Safety and Nutrition Level Among Children by Increasing the Quality of Local Food Production

description.narrative:
Chronic malnutrition is often the result of limited financial and physical access to safe food products and it may lead to serious problems within the society. Although the level of malnutrition has gone down over the last years in Bolivia, this issue is still considered as a high priority.
In order to tackle these problems, the Government of Bolivia has launched different programmes and has been receiving external assistance. With this regard, in the period from 2009 to 2013 and under the coordination of UNIDO Trade Capacity Branch, the first Joint Program “Capacity building for the local response toward the implementation of PMD-C sectorial initiatives (Fortalecimiento de la Capacidad de Respuesta Local para la Ejecución de Iniciativas Sectoriales del PMD-C)” was successfully implemented in 22 the most vulnerable municipalities of the country.
Following the results of this program, UNIDO together with the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) and the United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) developed further steps, which should further increase the food safety in Bolivia, especially in rural regions of the country. These have led to a second Joint Program “Mejoramiento de la situación nutricional de niñas y niños a partir del fortalecimiento de Sistemas Alimentarios Sostenibles Locales”, which implementation phase will start on 1st of January 2015 and will be co-funded by Spanish Sustainable Development Goals Fund (SDG-F) and the implementing agencies – 50/50. It was negotiated that UNIDO’s co-funding will be covered by an in kind contribution by the Bolivian Government.
The main general objective of the entire Joint Program is to improve the nutrition of children by strengthening the local food production. The program is addressing the issue of malnutrition from a multi-sectoral perspective, namely by seeing food safety and nutrition as a process that includes: a) Food producers, with special focus on the production of nutritionally high-value crops and their transformation (added value) into safe food products. b) Participative development and implementation of the knowledge building strategy on eating habits, in particular through: -awareness raising among children and their parents -increasing the responsibility and safety among enterprises and institutions, which are involved in the food production chain c) Raise discussion within and improved co-ordination between different institutions and organizations, which are involved in the local food production.
Under the umbrella of the Joint Program, UNIDO through its Trade Capacity Building Branch is seen as an essential partner in the project, especially due to its earlier participation and herewith obtained knowledge in the area. Furthermore, based on UNIDO’s long term expertise it can significantly contribute to improvement of product safety by reduction of inconsistency within national quality infrastructure system. Herein UNIDO through involvement of its experts, purchase of equipment and sustainable knowledge building is able to provide valuable inputs to tackle the problem of malnutrition and food safety in Bolivia.
The direct UNIDO intervention within the general framework of the Joint Program goes along the following core lines: - Identification and selection of active and motivated women-led small scale enterprises, realization of their main challenges and their improved integration in the local food production - Technical assistance and training in order to upgrade the good manufacturing practices and safety level of products, and to upgrade its closer conformity with existing requirements. Strong thematic focus on nutrition, sustainability and gender issues. - Screening the improvement progress within the selected enterprises through direct advocacy and / or capacity building by developing recommendations both for food safety as well as good manufacturing practices.

participating-org.narrative: Spanish Fund for Sustainable Development Goals
Trust Fund for Trade-related Capacity Building
